parsedComplaintsResult.impact: A loose or failed steering column can cause the steering wheel to move excessively, making it difficult to steer, and potentially leading to accidents.
symptoms: Excessive play and movement in the steering wheel

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the power steering system in cold temperatures can cause the steering wheel to become hard to turn, making it difficult to control the vehicle, and potentially leading to accidents.
symptoms: Steering wheel becomes hard to turn in cold temperatures
power steering fails to operate when cold

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Failure of the steering rack can cause the steering wheel to lock up or become difficult to turn, making it difficult to control the vehicle, and potentially leading to accidents.
Engine stalling or loss of power can cause the loss of steering, brakes, and other essential vehicle systems, making it difficult to control the vehicle, and potentially leading to accidents.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Electrical System Failure Leading to Vehicle Fires
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause fires, which can lead to vehicle damage, injury, or even fatalities.
symptoms: Smoke coming from under the dash

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The stalling of the engine without warning can cause loss of control, leading to accidents or near-misses, and can also lead to loss of power steering and brakes.
The failure of the air mass sensor can cause engine stalling, leading to loss of control and potential accidents.
The failure of the battery can cause inconvenience and leave the driver stranded.
